You use the tiff module to read and parse tiff files.

Imports

readNumber, metadata, tiffTags, tpub, xmpparser, bytesToString, ranges, imageData

Types

Kind {...}{.size: 2, pure.} = enum
  bytes = 1, strings, shorts, longs, rationals, sbytes, blob, sshorts, slongs, srationals,
  floats, doubles
IFDEntry types.
  1. bytes, uint8
  2. strings, one or more ASCII strings each ending with 0. Count includes the 0s.
  3. shorts, uint16
  4. longs, uint32
  5. rationals, two uint32, numerator then denominator.
  6. sbytes, s stands for signed.
  7. blob, list of bytes.
  8. sshorts
  9. slongs
  10. srationals
  11. floats, float32
  12. doubles, float64
IFDEntry = object
  tag*: uint16
  kind*: Kind
  number: uint32
  packed*: array[4, uint8]
  endian*: Endianness
  headerOffset*: uint32
Image File Directory (IFD) Entry information. The tag, kind, count and packed fields correspond to the 12 byte entries in the tiff file. 
IFDInfo = object
  nodeList*: seq[tuple[name: string, node: JsonNode]]
  nextList*: seq[tuple[name: string, offset: uint32]]
Image File Directory (IFD) information. The node list contains the IFD section node (name and metadata). In addition it may contain other types of nodes, i.e, xmp, iptc, etc. The next list contains the pointers to additional IFDs found in the current IFD. The first item is the offset to the next IFD (which may be 0), followed by subifds or exif, if there are any. 
TiffImageData = object
  width*: int32
  height*: int32
  starts*: seq[uint32]
  counts*: seq[uint32]
Image metadata for an image. The width and height of the image and to file offsets of the image pixel data.

Procs

proc count(entry: IFDEntry): int {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
proc kindSize(kind: Kind): Natural {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Return the number of bytes the given kind uses. 
proc readHeader(file: File; headerOffset: uint32): tuple[ifdOffset: uint32,
    endian: Endianness] {...}{.raises: [Exception, UnknownFormatError],
                        tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Read the tiff header at the given offset and return the offset of the first image file directory (IFD) and the endianness of the file. Raise UnknownFormatError when the file is not a tiff file. 
proc getIFDEntry(buffer: openArray[uint8]; endian: Endianness; headerOffset: uint32): IFDEntry {...}{.
    raises: [NotSupportedError], tags: [].}
Return an IFDEntry from the specified entry bytes. 
proc find[T, S](a: T; item: S; start: Natural = 0): int {...}{.inline.}
Find the item in an array and return its index or -1. Start searching at the given start index. 
proc parseStrings(buffer: openArray[uint8]): JsonNode {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Parse the buffer and return the strings in a JSON array. 
proc readBlob(file: File; entry: IFDEntry): seq[uint8] {...}{.
    raises: [ValueError, NotSupportedError, IOError], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Read and return the entry's value list as a list of uint8s. The item kind must be bytes or blob. 
proc readOneNumber(file: File; entry: IFDEntry): int32 {...}{.
    raises: [ValueError, NotSupportedError], tags: [].}
Read one entry number and return it as an int32. It can be a long, slong, short, sshort, bytes or sbytes. If the number is an uint32, it must be less than the maximum int32. An error is raised if there is more than one number or if the entry kind is not a number. 
proc readLongs(file: File; entry: IFDEntry; maximum: Natural): seq[uint32] {...}{.
    raises: [ValueError, NotSupportedError, IOError], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Read and return the entry's value list as a list of uint32s. The item kind must be longs. The maximum parameter limits the number of items to read. An error is raised when the number of items in the file exceeds the maximum. 
proc readValueList(file: File; entry: IFDEntry): JsonNode {...}{.
    raises: [IOError, UnknownFormatError], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Read the list of values of the IFD entry from the file and return the data as a JSON array. 
proc readValueListMax(file: File; entry: IFDEntry; maximumCount: Natural = 20;
                     maximumSize: Natural = 1000): JsonNode {...}{.
    raises: [IOError, UnknownFormatError, ValueError], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Read the entry's value list. For lists that exceed the maximum, return a short string instead. 
proc `$`(entry: IFDEntry): string {...}{.raises: [IOError, UnknownFormatError, ValueError],
                                tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Return a string representation of the IFDEntry. 
proc getIFDEntries(buffer: openArray[uint8]; headerOffset: uint32; ifdOffset: uint32;
                  endian: Endianness; nodeName: string; ranges: var seq[Range]): seq[
    IFDEntry] {...}{.raises: [NotSupportedError], tags: [].}
Return the entries for the given buffer. The buffer contains the 12 byte entries which start 2 bytes after the IFD offset. Also fill in the ranges. 
proc readIFD(file: File; id: int; headerOffset: uint32; ifdOffset: uint32;
            endian: Endianness; nodeName: string; ranges: var seq[Range]): IFDInfo {...}{.raises: [
    IOError, NotSupportedError, ValueError, UnknownFormatError, Defect, OSError,
    Exception, UnpackError, KeyError], tags: [ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
Read the Image File Directory at the given offset and return its metadata information as a list of named nodes. The list contains at least an IFD node and it may contain other nodes as well. Also return a list of offsets to other IFDs found. The ranges list is filled in with the ranges found in the IFD. 
proc readExif(file: File; headerOffset: uint32; finish: uint32; ranges: var seq[Range]): Metadata {...}{.raises: [
    Exception, UnknownFormatError, IOError, NotSupportedError, ValueError, Defect,
    OSError, UnpackError, KeyError], tags: [ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
Parse the exif bytes and return its metadata. The ranges list is filled in with the ranges found in the IFD. 
proc addSection(metadata: var Metadata; dups: var Table[string, int];
               sectionName: string; info: JsonNode) {...}{.raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Add the section to the given metadata. If the section already exists in the metadata, put it in an array. 
proc readTiff(file: File): Metadata {...}{.raises: [Exception, UnknownFormatError, IOError,
    NotSupportedError, ValueError, Defect, OSError, UnpackError, KeyError],
                                  tags: [ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
Read the given Tiff file and return its metadata. Return UnknownFormatError when the file format is unknown. May return NotSupportedError exception.
